result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cloise Allen Crape

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cloise Allen Crape appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Cloise Allen Crape.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is not present and requests an adjournment. Defense objects. Court grants the adjournment request. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Cloise Allen Crape.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Kuehn has been appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Br 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing, State's Witnesses are present. SPD has not appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with TVW, TC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $3,500.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Cloise Allen Crape in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
